titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1 IV:45. Tyber Square— Sun rose 5:45 behind 2d. Tree S. Treasy. Same as 12. Septr.

list.item: Storrs Mrs and her Son— soliciting Cadet’s place or Midshipman

list.head: Visits

list.item: Thomas— Jesse B— His opinion of Lincoln of Maine— Gales & Seaton

list.head: Visits

list.item: Smith Joseph L.— About Macon— Complaints and grievances.
Mills— Elijah H— Proceedings of Senate— Precedents— Principles
Clay— H. Reply to Poinsett of 22. Septr. symbols Jesup.
Barber. Noyes. With Meml & Papers— Naval Academy New-London
Wilson of Louisiana— Settlement of his Accounts.
Williston— Subscription for 5. Volumes of American Eloquence

item.label: Resn. on Amendment to Constn. Question taken H.R.
Collector of Champlain district— reccom: A Parsons

list.item: Miss Mease left us— Goes to Mrs Lee’s— Georgetown
Hellen, Johnson. To Rockville— Comes to reside at Washington
Little. Acts 3.18.
Addison. John 14.15
Wirt. W. A.G. Sent for Draft reply to Senate on Bissell’s case
Rush S.T— Discussion upon the Draft of reply— to be altered
Brent. Daniel— Answers to Forsyth’s Call
Barbour S.W. Case of Cadet Swift— And Bissell’s. Joness double Rn
Hay— George— About Giles and Randolph. Dines here to-morrow.
Niles. H— Visit— Left Randolph invectiving
Geddes. John— T.t.l— going to-morrow— His own dispositions
Webster— of M’Lane’s and Forsyth’s Amendments. Panama Mission
Hellen Johnson, from Rockville— to reside here.
Test.— about 2 Letters of his relating to Regr. Indianapolis

list.head: Visits—
list.item: S
Rush. S.T— Letter from E. Thompson of R. Cutters
Brent. Daniel— Offley— and Creighton’s claims
Clay S.S.— Rept. on Resn. H.R— for Middleton’s Note of 2 July &c
White Jos. M— Boundary between Georgia and Florida— Macon
Bates— Visitor from Charlestown
Everett. E.— Upon Buchanan’s proposed Resolution
Hay— George— to dine
Lowrie— Secy Sen—

list.head: Comee

list.item: Southard S.N.
Drawing Room— Miss Mease
Rush S.T.
Wirt. A.G— Final draft of Message to Senate on Bissell
Grier Chaplain
Rush— S.T.

list.head: Visits
list.item: Crump of Va
Clay S.S— despatches from A. H. Everett and R. King.
symbols Southard S.N. For Taliaferro as Indian Agent to be transferred.
Bell— Case of Hamtramck
Sloane— With recommendations of J. C. Wright— M’Lane’s Panama Resn.
Barbour S.W. With proceeds of Court Martial vs Coll. Chambers. Indn. Agency
Tomlinson— Concerning M’Lane’s Resns. and Surveyor Middletown.
Taliaferro— for his namesake— Indian Agency

list.head: Visits from Baltimore. Indian Vocabulary

list.item: Cobb— Creek Indians— Project of a New Treaty.
Seymour— Collector at Champlain— Sailly. Palmer— Woodbury’s Letters
Rush S.T.
Southard S.N.
Gales of Raleigh

list.head: symbols Clay and symbols
list.item: Southard
Brent— D.
Heard Little. Acts 17.27.
Thomas Jesse B. symbols Macon, Lowrie, Randolph, Benton Noble Ruggles—
Heard Hawley— Revelations 22.17.
Barbour. S.W— Cobb’s proposals— declined. Coll. Chambers to resign
Brearley— Coll— Creek Indians— reconciln.— Berrien—
Clay. S.S— Note to Salazar— Medn— The meeting.
Hitchcock— Pickens arrived— District Judge Alabama. Crawford. Dillet
Barbour. S.W— Answer to Cobb— Hamtramck. Indian Agent. Taliaferro
Southard S.N— Boston Sloop of War to Sail— C. Smith & Bourne
Cook. D. P— Private War at Sea— Secret Laws. Florida. Cuba— Chambers

div.p: 11. V:35. Sun rose V:32— Clear— Ice.

list.item: Sanford— N— Publication by Senate of Executive Communications. Bissell.
Rush. S.T. claim of Judge Scott of Arkansas

list.head: Visits
Visits— Tallmadge Cousin of Lt. Govr

list.item: Barbour S.W.— Hamtramck recomd. Agent to Osage’s— Objections.
Bode— with Dissertn. on Poems of Orpheus.
Merwin— Distt. Judge Connt. Tomlinson. Bristol. Edwards.
Southard— about C. Smith. Stuart’s Sandwich Id. Journal. Pettis.

div.p: 12. V. Capitol— Sun rose 5:31.— George 25. Frost.

list.head:
Senators from Alabama.
Visits.

list.item: Sherburne— Going to-morrow for Portsmouth— Naval Office.
Rush. S.T— Claims for Services in Florida.
Wirt. A.G.— Morning call

list.head: Marshall Alabama— Crawford for Distt. judge

list.item: Armstrong. Andrew— Treaty of Hayti with France.
Hebb.— for Place— Reference to Dorsey.
Brent. D.— Report on Executive. Appts. during the recess.
Pedersen— from Philadelphia— Instns. for Treaty from his Govt.
Clay S.S. Vaughan’s Decrn agt. Intn. on Slave Convention. Extra Mission.

div.p: 13. IV:15. Capitol Bridge— Sun rose 5:30. S. of S.E edge State Dept. high tree Same as 31. Augt.

list.item: Armstrong. Andrew— Treaty between France and Hayti
Dinsmoor of Alabama— District judge— W. Crawford
Mallary— About C. K. Williams. Bradley— C. P. Van Ness— Panama Mission
Cameron—with Letter from H. G. Burton— Wants to be Commr Banky.
Pleasonton. S— Light-house keepers— Flaherty to be sent by Rev. Cutter.
Adams— Young man, asks for employment in Patent Office.
Southard. S.N— Sloop of War to cruize on the fishery Coast. Eastport 2 July.
Amory— R. G— Visits
Codman—from Boston— going tomorrow for St. Louis Missouri

list.head:
Visits
White declines going to the Florida Indians

list.item: Party at Genl Brown’s—
Lowrie W.— Resn. S. advising appt. of Paymasters

list.head: Comee with 1. Enrolled Bill.

list.item: Rush S.T. Accounts of Claims in Florida Negn. of Land Office
Thomas J. B. Recommg of Hamtramck— Benton’s
Trulock— Mrs Lydia, from Baltimore.
Clay. S.S.— Pedersen’s proposals— Note from Vaughan of Slaves.
Pearce— D. J.— Eveg— Webster’s Speech this day.
Thompson. Alexr— for restoration of Coll Chambers—
Brent. D.— Heap’s Appt. of Consul at Tunis— Salary from Novr 1825.
Hunter John— With recommendns. H.R.U.S. Supt. Indn. Affairs

list.head:
from Princeton, in Vacation
his Son in law recently from the Havana
list.item: Hays Captain
Blake— G.— Visit— Elections in Masstts. Panama. Webster’s speech
Clay SS— Note from Vaughan— Slave indemnity. Draft of Answer

list.head:
Appointment of District Judge, in Connecticut
Daggett, Bristol, Lanman, Edwards, Tomlinson.

list.item: Williams, from Florida— For place. Register of Land-Office
Bradish— Enquires if Letter from him Const. Decr 1820 was recd.
Everett. E— Returned. Yates, Convention of 1787— Slavery
Pope— N— Debates in S. and H.R. Appt. of Comees. in Senate restored
Dorsey— Clemt— did not see him— Wanted Explann of Message
Heard Little Proverbs 5.22–23. Sarcastic.
Baker— Nahum 1.7.

list.head: Visitors.
list.item: Vernon— his nephew
Russell G. C— To plead for restoration of Coll. Chambers.
Brent. D— Note of P.U.S. 6. Octr. 1804. Temporary Commn.
M’Arthur— Genl.— About Judge S.C. from Ohio.
Letcher. Judge of District Court in Kentucky— Boyle.

item.persRef: Van Rensselaer. S. Mrs and Miss.

list.item: Roberdeau— Coll. and Misses Mary, Susan and Selina
Lynch D.— Ouseley Mr— Bradish. Luther— Evening

div.p: 18. V:30.— After Sun rise— College 1. hour 20 minutes

list.item: Lowrie. Resn. Senate— A. Binney rejected.
Bell— Saml— Bissell’s case— Harrison.
Gurley— Recomn: T. B. Robertson Judge S.C. Coll. Chambers
Brent. W. L. Recomn. Porter and Robertson— Coll. Chambers
Williams— of Maryland going to Florida— Regr. Land-Office
Armstrong. Andrew— Hayti Newspapers— Recognition
Brent D.— Answer to Letter Chairman Comee. For. Relns. H.R.
Denson Jesse— Application for Appointment as Naval Chaplain
Clay S.S. Treaty Negotiating with Pedersen—

list.head:
Visits—
of N. Jersey
of Virginia.
list.item: Southard S.N.

div.p: Barbour S.W.— Court-Martial on Coll. Chambers— and Cadle
Rush. S.T. Florida Land-Offices— W. H. Allen and Love

list.head: With M’Lane’s and Buchanan’s Amendments to the Resn. of expediency for appropriations, for the Panama Mission.

div.p: 19. VI— Met Wood. Walk to Georgetown Bridge

list.item: Conner— Benjamin— for papers concerning bridges.
Southard S.N. Nomination of Navy Agent. Boston— R. D. Harris
Lowry— Revd for his Son, a Midshipman’s warrant.
Thomas. Jesse B.— The judiciary Bill— arrangemt of Circuits.
Brent— Daniel— for Draft of Convn with Denmark & Heaps Insns.
Barbour S.W. Memorial from Coll. Chambers. Cadle’s Ct. Martial
Clay S.S. Project of Treaty with Denmark. Resns. H.R. Panama
Drawing-room—

div.p: 20. VI:15. Over Tyber Bridges— Met Wirt.

list.item: Mills. E. H.— Upon Branch’s Resn. J. Randolph 7 hours raving.
Brent. D.— Mr Clay’s Answer to Mr Vaughan. Slave-indemnity.

list.head: With 2 Enrolled Bills— signed

list.item: Hunter J. W. with bill for Superintendency of Indian Affairs
Barbour S.W— with Letter from Tattnall about M’Intosh Indians
Warner— from N.Y. for Claimants upon France
Rush. S.T. Thomson’s teas— Josh. Randall assistant Counsel.
Bailey— J— proceedings. H.R. M’Lane & Buchanan 99.95

div.p: 21: VI:15. Towards Capitol. Met and walked with Bell

list.item: Wright. R— Approves Admn. His Son gone Consul to Rio Janyro
Southard S.N— Brandywine arrived at N.Y.
Brent— D— Mr Clay’s Ansr. to Vaughan W. Pinckney & Monroe’s Comn
Gallatin. A— from Baltimore. Will go to England Indn. Vocabulary
Frye— Nl— To ask Mills not to go home
Brown— Genl— Of P.M.G. M’lean’s uneasiness— J. A. Dix
Clay S.S— Convention with Denmark, agreed upon.
Lowrie— W— Creek Treaty, advised & Resn: Missouri next Session.

list.head:
Visits— Knight Member of Senate Pa. and Surveyor
Sill Member H.R.U.S. in place of Farrelly.
Panama Mission. appropn. Bill H.R. yesterday
Creek Treaty—
list.item: Knight.
Clary— from New-York— Visitor by curiosity.

list.head: H.R.U.S. Kentucky— to recommend Tompkins as District judge in place of R. Trimble

list.item: Rush S.T.— Draft of Answer to Jonn. Jennings. copies of his Letters
Barbour S.W. To send away the Creek Indians.

list.head:
Comee. Enrolled Bills— with two Bills—
Lands in Florida— Mississippi and Alabama
list.item: Knight

list.head: To obtain discharge of Joseph Douglas, a coloured boy, from the Brandywine
list.item: and a boy

list.head:
Visits— Approprn. Panama— passed H.R.U.S.
Son of L. Morris signer of Decn. of Independence
list.item: Morris— from NY.

list.head: Visits— Angry debate in H.R. upon a Bill to pay for a Negro killed in War. Genl. Jackson
list.item: Scott of Mard

div.p: Tomlinson— Distt. Judge, Connecticut Recomms for him
Bradish— L— Distressed about assertions of Ld. Strangford’s letters

list.head: Evening visits.

div.p: 23 V: Sun rose 5:16. Behind tallest chimney State Dept.

list.item: Heard Stapler and Wetherall— of the Friends, at the Capitol
Post at Baker’s. Luke 14.22— And yet there is room
Webster here— did not see him— Walk with Wilson.

list.head: Evening visits.

div.p: 24. V. Sun rose 5.15. Behind Middle Chimney State Dept.

list.item: Same 17. Augt.— Tyber Bridge Square walk.

list.head: Visits— Hughes returns tomorrow to Baltimore, and is to sail next week for Rotterdam

list.item: Barbour S.W. About the new Creek Treaty

list.head: Visits— Skinner gave me an invitation to the Cattle Show in June

list.item: Clay S.S. Recommends W. Duane, as Agent to the Havanna
Tutt. C. P with Letter from L— Lee, for an Appointment

list.head: Visits— Dupont came here on account of his Son’s promotion from Midshipman to Lieutenant—
list.item: Van Dyke’s father ill—
Brent D.— For W. Pinkney’s Commission 12 May 1806

list.head: Visitors— The Woodruffs are from New-Jersey
list.item: Southard S.N.
Caldwell. Charles— giving Lectures here on phrenology
Brown Genl— Clintonian Caucus Address—
Biddle— Captn— Mentioned death of king of Portugal 9. March
Rush. S.T.— Answer to Jonathan Jennings’s enquiries— Land-Office
At Mr T. B. Johnson’s— Party at Barrells
Francis— From Connecticut— Visitor Self-introduced
Mills— Returned Jenkinson’s Treaties— Going after to-morrow.
Booth— for appointment in Brearley’s place. Navy-Yard.
Mower. Post-Office at New-York— Carrier-boy thief.
Rush. S.T— The Answer to Jennings— Register at Indianapolis

list.head: Visitors

list.item: Cobb— Talk about Indian Treaty. Crowell— Cobb going home
Thomas. Judiciary bill, likely to fail N. Pope dissatisfied

list.head: Visits Donaldson from St. Johns New-Brunswickabout to return there
list.item: Donaldson
White. Jos. M— Regr. & Receiver E. Florida, Commn discontinued
Message to S.U.S.— N. 39— Nominations
Message to H.R.U.S. N. 26.

list.head: Speaking with him of the judiciary bill—interrupted—
list.item: Visitors.
Brent. D— for draft to Middleton and Letter to Nicholas symbols
Hunter J. W.— for place of Naval Store-keeper
Rochester— Going to-morrow— Fears summer trip to Panama

list.head: Announced as Pennsylvania delegation— recommended J. W. Hunter as Naval Store-keeper at Navy Yard

div.p: Barbour S.W. Creek Indian distribution— Crowell not well disposed

list.head: Visitors.

list.item: Clarke H.R— Resn. for A.G’s opinion upon outfit.

list.head: Visits— L. M. Powell a Midshipman, returned from the Mediterranean in the Brandywine
list.item: His Son

list.head: Visits— The General and his family to leave the City next Monday.
list.item: His Son and boy
Chambers. Case of Bissell’s Nomination. Branch’s Resn. Tazewell
Clay S.S.— Treaty with Denmark. Dix to go special Messenger.
Opothle-Yoholo and deputation of Creek Indians T.T.L.

list.head: Visitors with Clay— Brady Speaker of the House ofRepresentatives Tennessee— Cochran of Virginia

list.item: M’Clain John— Revolutionary Sailor— For Pension
Hunter J. W. with Letter from L. Williams

list.head: Gamble a Major in the Marine Corps applies for brevet promotion.

For subscription to a Masonic Edifice
I promised to contribute $50

list.item: Scott. Alexander— Concg his Son & judge Brackenridge
Rose To recommend C. Selden Navy Store-keeper

list.head: Visitors—
list.item: Stewart of Pa.

div.p: Hitchcock— of Alabama— For Crawford as District Judge

list.head: Visits— Carter recommends Barkley for Marshal Western Distt S.C— N.C. Gold mines.
list.item: Carter of S.C.
Answer to Emperor of Russia, notifying death of Alexander
Commission to Levy Court Washington Co. to 1st. Monday May 1827
Credential Letter H. Middleton to Nicholas 1—
Message to S.U.S— N. 40. Convention with Denmark.
Miller John— Enquiries concerning nomination of Sailly
Sanford— For Wright’s Letter to Seymour. N.Y. & intl. improvement
Bell— For C. Cutts— Navy Agency Portsmouth— Branch’s Resn.

list.head: To recommend Dr. Bates as Navy Agent. Boston. Told them Harris was already nominated

list.item: Rush. S.T. Letter from judge Van Ness— Assistant Counsel N.Y.

list.head:
Visits
from Tennessee.

list.item: Lowrie W— 2. Resns. S.U.S. Navy Nominations. Chambers Court Martial
Taylor. G.— For Appointment of Navy Agent vice Brearley
Pedersen— Going to Philadelphia. Monday.

list.head: Visits— Hiester is Surveyor General of the State of Pennsylvania.

Visits— M’Kee is from Wheeling Virginia.
Ruggles resides in Ohio— across the river.

list.item: Wyer— Going tomorrow for St. Petersburg symbols
Miller. Thomas— Applicant for Navy Agency— vice Brearley

list.head: Cabinet Meeting— Instructions to Panama Mission— Payment for Independence— Recognition of Hayti— Canal from Sea to Sea— discussed.
list.item: Clay— S.S.
Rush S.T.
Barbour S.W.
Southard S.N.
Everett E. in the Evening— Judiciary Bill in jeopardy—
Mrs A. and girls— Evening party at Mr Rush’s.
Message to H.R. N. 27— Attorney General’s opinion.

div.p: 30. IV:45. Sun rose 5.8. between the two S.W. Chimnies State Dept. Same 13. August.

list.item: Heard Little. Proverbs 3.16. Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
No Church at Baker’s. Met Campbell of Ohio, and Harris of Pa
Heard Gray at Hawley’s. Matthew 22.42. What think ye of Christ?
B. Bassett. young V. Rensselaer & his Sister there.
Lee— W— at Eve— Baron Tuyll died two days after sailing from New York.
Taylor J. W. fiduciary Bill— Might it not be dispensed with? disagreement between the two Houses.
